title: FS: T216 Mino & Kotton, T213 Coupon II
author: gfgcom

posts.post_title: FS: T216 Mino & Kotton, T213 Coupon II
posts.post_content:
Well, we had another huge find at Dave's two weeks ago.  We have sold a few cards already, but still have over 300 left from the Chattanooga Tenn find.  We just got 150 cards back yesterday from SGC (Thanks Scott H for the quick service!)
Mostly T213-II (159 in stock, 70 to still to be keyed in), t216 Kotton (38, including 3 thin paper), T216 mino (6) D303 General baking (7) and D304 general baking (7)

Still have lots of big names, also picked up some tough anonymous back T207 cards, all in lesser grade.

You can visit up and take a look, with the exception of the T213-II, all cards are listed with images, and the rest of the hall of fame T213-II will be up shortly.

Here are a few images of cards that we have:
[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/328/64588.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/328/64620.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/876/122544.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/810/119213.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/875/122507.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.gfg.com/cardimg/875/122517.jpg[/IMG]

You can get to all of these cards and more using the links on our [url]https://www.gfg.com/baseball/tobacco.shtml[/url]Tobacco page!

Or, just send us email, or call.  Email is best, cards are first come first serve.

Thanks for taking a look

Dave, Art, and Fred!

[quote name="gfgcom" post=933510][url]https://www.gfg.com/baseball/t207.shtml[/url]T207s

[url]https://www.gfg.com/baseball/t216.shtml[/url]Mino & Kotton

[url]https://www.gfg.com/baseball/d303.shtml[/url]General Baking

[url]https://www.gfg.com/baseball/coupon.shtml[/url]Coupon II (hof images coming)[/QUOTE]

Thanks for posting.  You have great cards, but it's a real pita wading through all the *SOLD* markers.  Maybe *SOLD* should be a set of 'past items' pages.

Scott,

what I have started to do is put the archive images at the bottom of the pages so that the price list with what is available comes up first.

I like having the images up there so folks can see the cards, some people never get a chance to look at these.

Anyway, I am making some changes on the site, and all the archive images may end up in a different place in a few months, so please bear with me.

Thanks

Dave
